p: Results of segmented regression for confirmed cases are shown in Table 1. Baseline time trend showed a significant increase (Estimate = 0.316; p < 0.001). The number of confirmed cases was increased by 9.632 on 5 June ( p < 0.001). It showed a significant downward trend following disclosure of hospital list (Estimate = âˆ’0.699; p < 0.001). The spread of the disease ceased because potential MERS-CoV patients were screened. Figure 2 shows results and predictions of the statistical analysis. Results of sensitivity analyses are shown in Table 2. They were almost consistent with those shown in Table 1.
